results.title: Film technique: editing. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Explains the editor’s responsibilities and summarises the various stages of editing. The first part deals mainly with the editing of silent films. The second part is more complex and discusses the editing of film with sound and synchronising sound and picture. Intended for film and TV trainees and technical colleges.

results.title: Film tactics
results.brief_description: A vivid and humorous presentation of how to use sound films to the best effect, and the various results of different kinds of failures on the part of the instructor using a sound film.

results.title: Film problems
results.brief_description: This film presents problems arising when filming a person walking into a room to talk to someone. Explains that certain effects can be created in the minds of an audience by the way the sequence is filmed and edited. Uses animation and live action to illustrate examples of variation achieved by changes in camera movement and placement, composition of scene, and cutting during or at junction points of action. The film concludes with scenes selected to form a sequence for audience interpretation.

results.title: Stunts: fights and falls
results.creator_credit: Tony De Zarraga and Tim Barr
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Like good athletes, stuntmen must warm up before attempting any feats. Control and practice are of paramount importance. For realism rehearsal in the front of a camera and the matching of the movements of the actor and stuntman are essential. The narrator Jack Mohoney, as well as giving the historical background to stunts in films gives many hints on safety and training.

results.title: Overview of 8mm production
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
This film introduces the student to a general background on the making of 8mm films. Attention is given to the kinds of equipment required, the use of camera and film editing.

results.title: Make-up: aging and hair
results.creator_credit: Tony De Zarraga and Tim Barr
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Beau Hickman, of “Spartacus” and “The Ten commandments” fame, demonstrates basic makeup techniques that easily fall into everyone’s budget. Using a variety of materials, the student learns the techniques of the aging process and the application of beards and moustaches, black eyes, skin tones and built-up noses.

results.title: Lighting on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Larry Boehlins, an experienced “gaffer” covers key points such as: sources of power, hook up, the use of filters on lights and cameras, polaroid filters, window diffusion, use of reflectors etc. The film introduces a variety of grip equipment.

results.title: So you're going on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
If pre-production meetings have been carefully enough organised then going on location should pose no problem. The location chosen is determined by the demands of the script, but before it is actually chosen permits for its use, budgetary considerations and familiarisation by the crew are essential. The film gives numerous hints for filming and graphically explains points of job allocations, camera use and lighting.
